title: Selma To Montgomery National Historic Trail: Park Home
body: The Right to Vote!!!  On August 6, 1965, President Lyndon Johnson signed, the Voting Rights Act of 1965, which extended equal voting rights for African-Americans. As both White and Black non-violent supporters led by Dr. Martin Luther King Jr. fought for the right to vote in Central Alabama, today, you can trace their march toward freedom on the 54-mile trail and connect with their stories at the Interpretive Centers. Read More             Volunteers-In-Parks   Help support your National Historic Trail by becoming a volunteer.
